acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: There is no acute inhalation-toxicity-test result about steam, and it cannot be classified. It is the metal of nonvolatility and it is thought that the inhalation test in steam cannot be done.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Since there is no LD50 data about metals thallium, it cannot be classified. If this metal touches with air, the surface will oxidize. There is data of 32mg/kg (EHC 39 (1984)) in LD50 of an oxide, and it is thought that Category 2 level is appropriate for powder.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is no information about metal thallium. EPA has been classified into D about the compound. Moreover, there is also information (EHC 39 (1984)) that a tumor-suppressing effects occurs. On the other hand, Lide (2004) has the statement which suggests carcinogenicity.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: May cause long lasting harmful effects to aquatic life
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 4, since it is metal and the behavior in the water is unknown, though L(E) C50 <=100 mg/L .

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Although it is thought that an aggregated metal does not burn, metal powder burns easily. The object should be classified after defined test was carried out.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance was classified as "Category 1B" because the dominant lethal test in rats using thallous carbonate was positive  (EHC 39 (1984)). Metal thallium can be turned into thallous carbonate by oxygen and carbon dioxide in the air.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Containing no oxygen , chlorine and fluorine.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: There is no information that it ignites spontaneously in the reliable data collection of physicochemical nature.

reproductive_toxicity.classification: Category 1A, Additional category: Effects on or via lactation
reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement:
May damage fertility or the unborn child
May cause harm to breast-fed children
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since there is the example of human transplacental alopecia by the intake of thallium compound (ACGIH (2001)), it is classified into the "Category 1A." The effect to sperm, neonatal chondrodysplasia and infant alopecia via lactation are also reported in the animal experiments (ACGIH (2001), EHC 39 (1984)).

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Uncategorizable because of no information related to sensitization.

self_heating_substances.rationale: In the case of powdered, the test data on self-heating cannot be found out, and cannot be classified.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is no eye dose response data, and it cannot classify.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is no Draize test data on animals, and it cannot be classified. As for the compounds, intense influence on the skin at the time of the human addiction has been found.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Uncategorizable because of no information related to sensitization.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: There is a statement of not dissolving into water and it is thought that severe reaction does not start.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (circulatory system, brain, nervous system, skin appendage)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (circulatory system, brain, nervous system, skin appendage)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Although circulatory systems,nervous systems and alopecia were taken based on the statement of ICSC (2002), since the effect to brain in the animal experiments was described, it was classified in "Category 1 (circulatory  system, a brain and a nervous system, attached vessel)."

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (digestive system, nervous system, skin appendage)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (digestive system, nervous system, skin appendage)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Due to the gastroenteritis, polyneuropathy, and acomia are major symptoms of thallium poisoning (EHC 39 (1984)), it was classified into "Category 1 (digestive systems, nervous systems, skin (appendage))".
